notes.note: Fixed a case where having a contact and card in an address book with the same name could send to the mailing list (Bug 1008718)
Importing an RSA private key fails if p < q (see bug 1049435)
Installing extensions within Thunderbird requires download and installing as a file (bug 1081190)
Users of jp mac builds may have issues with no mail folders being displayed in the main window. Running Thunderbird in 32-bit mode temporarily will workaround this issue.

system_requirements:
Windows

Operating Systems
  • Windows XP SP2
  • Windows Server 2003
  • Windows Vista
  • Windows 7
  • Windows 8

Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Thunderbird, only 32-bit builds of Thunderbird are supported at this time.

Recommended Hardware
  • Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
  • 1GB RAM
  • 200 MB hard drive space

Mac

Operating Systems
  • Mac OS X 10.6
  • Mac OS X 10.7
  • Mac OS X 10.8
  • Mac OS X 10.9
Recommended Hardware
  • Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
  • 512 MB RAM
  • 200 MB hard drive space

Linux

Software Requirements
Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.
  • Thunderbird will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    • GTK+ 2.18 or higher
    • GLib 2.22 or higher
    • Pango 1.14 or higher
    • X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    • libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
  • For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    • NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    • DBus 1.0 or higher
    • HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    • GNOME 2.16 or higher
